meanings.definition: Likely or liable to be influenced or harmed by a particular thing
meanings.sent1: Children are susceptible to catching colds easily during the winter months.
meanings.sent2: She is susceptible to getting sunburned if she doesn't apply sunscreen.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed susceptible to the charms of the new toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His argument was so persuasive that even the most susceptible minds were swayed.
meanings.sent5: The delicate flower was susceptible to wilting in the hot sun.

meanings.definition: Easily affected or influenced by something
meanings.sent1: The old bridge was susceptible to damage from the heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: He is susceptible to getting emotional during sad movies.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so funny that even the most susceptible audience members burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like a fragile glass, easily cracked and susceptible to breaking.
meanings.sent5: The young sapling was susceptible to bending in the strong wind.
